Title: Digital Twin and Big Data Towards Smart Manufacturing and Industry 4.0: 360 Degree Comparison
Abstract: With the advances in new-generation information technologies, especially big data and digital twin, smart manufacturing is becoming the focus of global manufacturing transformation and upgrading. Intelligence comes from data. Integrated analysis for the manufacturing big data is beneficial to all aspects of manufacturing. Besides, the digital twin paves a way for the cyber-physical integration of manufacturing, which is an important bottleneck to achieve smart manufacturing. In this paper, the big data and digital twin in manufacturing are reviewed, including their concept as well as their applications in product design, production planning, manufacturing, and predictive maintenance. On this basis, the similarities and differences between big data and digital twin are compared from the general and data perspectives. Since the big data and digital twin can be complementary, how they can be integrated to promote smart manufacturing are discussed. © 2013 IEEE.

Authors: Zhuang C., Liu J., Xiong H., Ding X., Liu S., Weng G.
Title: Connotation, architecture and trends of product digital twin
Source title: Jisuanji Jicheng Zhizao Xitong/Computer Integrated Manufacturing Systems, CIMS
Abstract: Digital twin technology is considered as the core and crucial technology to fulfill cyber-physical systems. Product digital twin is one of applications of digital twin technology in the process of product development. However, the research on it is still in its infancy and there are only few unsystematic research findings presented. The concept of digital twin technology based on review of digital twin background and the architecture for product digital twin based on systematic analysis of its connotation were proposed. The implementation approach of product digital twin in the stage of product design, manufacturing and service was investigated. The evolving trends of product digital twin concerning its features in the future were predicted. © 2017, Editorial Department of CIMS. All right reserved.

Title: Project cost management – global issues and challenges

Authors: Liu C., Zhou Q., Lishan X.U., Yin Y., Qianguang S.U.
Title: Research and application of key technologies in intelligent, transparent and green digital twin construction site
Control and management of construction project cost
Study on management information system for construction engineering supervision based on ubiquitous environment
Source title: 2010 3rd IEEE International Conference on Ubi-Media Computing, U-Media 2010
Abstract: Information plays an important role during the engineering construction and supervision process, however, the means for processing of construction supervision information lags behind presently and the system features single function and fails to achieve information share and collaborative work. To establish a management information system for construction engineering supervision based on the relevant technology of pervasive computing (PESS) will allow you to carry out monitoring and supervision to the construction sites at all times and places without any limit of space and area. The supervision company and construction enterprises can access the supervision information integratedly distributed in different places anytime and anywhere to achieve the information-based support for the supervision core functions of "four controls, three managements and one coordination". © 2010 IEEE.

Title: Inheritance and innovation of engineering management informatization

Authors: Zhang H., Gao Y., Ding C.
Title: Research of BIM theoretical system based on big data thinking

Authors: Wang L., He Y., Han Y.
Title: Research on power engineering construction management based on BIM technology
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 International Conference on Robots and Intelligent System, ICRIS 2018
Abstract: With the progress of society and development of the economy, the quality of people's life is improving, and the high-tech computer information technology has also been widely promoted and applied. The application of BIM technology in the construction field has enabled the original construction project cost management to have breakthrough progress. This article first introduces the BIM technology briefly and then analyzes specific applications of BIM technology in the power engineering construction management. Practice proves that the application of BIM technology facilitates the visualization, integration, and automation of power engineering construction management, improves the efficiency of power engineering management greatly, reduces management costs, and has high application value. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yongling B., Shiliang L., Xing Z.
Title: Digitalization management mode of engineering supervision qualification and its application

Authors: Liang J., Zhang M., Yuan Y.
Title: Construction project collaboration management based on the BIM
Source title: 2011 International Conference on E-Business and E-Government, ICEE2011 - Proceedings
Abstract: The construction industry is shocked by the advance of Building Information Modeling, every country works hard to realize the BIM. And the application of collaboration management to manufacturing industry achieves good results since its setting. The paper analyses the application situation of the use of Collaboration management within the project management and the existent problems, such as difficulties in the information sharing and the information can't deliver smoothly. The process of project collaboration management is put forward. And the paper also discusses that the BIM creates for the phase of the design, bidding and construction, which makes the delivery of the Information smoothly and let the collaboration management more efficient. At last, it comes to a conclusion that it is necessary to set a new project organization up before using BIM during project management. © 2011 IEEE.
